modules.description: Computes CRC-32 checksums for binary data using a polynomial and initial value. Operates on Cstruct.t buffers and raw strings with specified offsets and lengths. Used for validating data integrity in protocols like Ethernet, PNG, and ZIP files.

Calculates CRC-32 checksums for byte buffers and strings using a standardized algorithm. It processes input data in chunks and returns a 32-bit polynomial-based hash. Used for validating data integrity in network protocols, file formats, and data transmission.

Calculates CRC-32 checksums for binary data using a configurable polynomial and initial value, supporting both Cstruct.t buffers and raw strings with offset and length parameters. It enables data integrity checks in protocols such as Ethernet, PNG, and ZIP by generating and verifying checksums. Operations include computing checksums incrementally or from full data sources. Examples include validating file headers, ensuring packet accuracy in network transfers, and verifying compressed data blocks.
